intro: Dipteracanthus strictus, commonly known as the narrowleaf dipteracanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Dipterocarpaceae, which includes many tropical trees and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
